blocks.text: As an illustration, consider the following case: A rough test gives 2x + 4 as a solution of the equation 3x + 1 - 1.534x + 27 - 554.
It is required to find a solution more correct.
If the correct value of x is found, then \( f(x) \) must = 0.

blocks.description: Calculation of f at the proposed solution.

blocks.text: Hence, a more correct approximation is x = 2.0073.

i.e., 

\[ x = 2.0073 \] is the solution of the equation.
This method may therefore be successfully employed in lieu of the graphical method and extremely accurate results may be obtained.
The following example illustrates the process of interpolation necessary in many cases where tables of values are needed.
Consider the situation where the accurate value of \( x \) is sought where \( x = 132^\circ C \) (the nearest to 132 is 130).

blocks.description: Calculating the second derivative of y with respect to x.

blocks.text: Calculate, very exactly, the value of \( \frac{d^2y}{dx^2} \) when \( x = 132^\circ C \).
